name: No. 1 Small Geo Flora Mirror
description:
Each mirror is treated with a unique 'tarnishing' technique devised by Ruth Parker; simple geometric patterns are drawn directly onto the mirrors silvering, whilst larger areas are removed to create a mottled antiqued effect. The exposed glass is then intricately decorated by collaging drawings that combining naturalistic flora with stylised geometric lines and blocks. Finished by a simple bees wax polished plywood backing with exposed edges and fittings so its ready to hang. The drawings where created specifically for this limited edition collection of mirrors for Makers Workshop. Each piece is hand-crafted and one of a kind. 

Ruth Parker is a London designer/maker working on the borders of fine-art and craft. Specializing in creating bespoke pieces that combine high craftsmanship with exciting and intricate ideas.

Diameter:

13-3/4"

name: Magus Pyramid Display Box
description:
Black pyramid display box with a clear glass door, available in silver or copper finish.
For thousands of years pyramids have been built by civilizations all over the world, as sacred places, sometimes hiding burial chambers filled with cherished objects and treasure. These delicate glass pyramids can be the home for your most precious possessions, in safe display for all to see.

Handmade from clear glass, black glass and a lead-free, silver alloy solder.

ABJ Glassworks is a small handmade business based in Philadelphia, PA.  Working to create whimsical and modern pieces for the home using traditional stained glass techniques, and inspired by the nuances of light throughout the day and the changing of the seasons.  Each product is made with concern for the environment, using eco-friendly techniques, non-toxic flux, and lead-free silver alloy solder, creating pieces for the person who appreciates beauty, functionality and the natural world.

Measurements
Width: 2"
Depth: 2"
Height: 2"

name: Large Geometric Flora Mirror
description:
Each mirror is treated with a unique 'tarnishing' technique devised by Ruth Parker; simple geometric patterns are drawn directly onto the mirrors silvering, whilst larger areas are removed to create a mottled antiqued effect. The exposed glass is then intricately decorated by collaging drawings that combining naturalistic flora with stylized geometric lines and blocks. Finished by a simple bees wax polished plywood backing with exposed edges and fittings so its ready to hang. The drawings where created specifically for this limited edition collection of mirrors for Makers Workshop. 

Ruth Parker is a London designer/maker working on the borders of fine-art and craft. Specializing in creating bespoke pieces that combine high craftsmanship with exciting and intricate ideas.

Each piece is hand-crafted and one of a kind.

Diameter:
21-5/8"

name: Teardrop Terrarium Kit
description:
Teardrop terrarium, available in silver or copper color.
This stained glass terrarium has a versatile shape, allowing you to hang it up or sit it on a table, windowsill, or anywhere you like. It has two openings so you and your plants can get inside.  Your terrarium will arrive as a kit, which includes a muslin pouch with pebbles, activated charcoal and a few suggestions for how to get your terrarium started. This style is great for succulents or air plants.

Terrariums are handmade using glass and a lead-free silver alloy solder.

ABJ Glassworks is a small handmade business based in Philadelphia, PA.  Working to create whimsical and modern pieces for the home using traditional stained glass techniques, and inspired by the nuances of light throughout the day and the changing of the seasons.  Each product is made with concern for the environment, using eco-friendly techniques, non-toxic flux, and lead-free silver alloy solder, creating pieces for the person who appreciates beauty, functionality and the natural world.

Measurements
Width: 4 1/4"
Depth: 4 1/8"
Height: 6"

name: Heart Pine Lamp
description:
This lamp features thin cut reclaimed heart pine pieces that allow light to pass through the sap, creating an amber glow. 

Matthew  Holdren designs and builds all of his furniture in his backyard workshop in New Orleans. All of his pieces are made from reclaimed material personally salvaged from 100+ year old new orleans homes left to rot or be torn down.  The old heart pine or cypress framing material, along with the patina of layers of old paint are what really enhance the furniture and bring a unique look to the piece.

Dimensions:

8" D x 8" W x 12" H

name: Vega Pyramid Display Box
description:

name: Henry Clay Media Console
description:
From Matthew Holdren, this mod Mid-Century console has a top of solid old growth poplar barge board.  The Henry Clay has three separate compartments: two doors that swing out to the sides and a center door that swings down with euro style hinges.  All of the door pulls are hand welded, old salvaged nails.  

Matthew  Holdren designs and builds all of his furniture in his backyard workshop in New Orleans. All of his pieces are made from reclaimed material personally salvaged from 100+ year old new orleans homes left to rot or be torn down.  The old heart pine or cypress framing material, along with the patina of layers of old paint are what really enhance the furniture and bring a unique look to the piece. 

Dimensions:

24" H x 65" W x 19.5" D

name: Gallier Chair
description:
Based on a traditional shaker design, colorful and natural heart pine provide the perfect dining or kitchen chair. 

Matthew  Holdren designs and builds all of his furniture in his backyard workshop in New Orleans. All of his pieces are made from reclaimed material personally salvaged from 100+ year old new orleans homes left to rot or be torn down.  The old heart pine or cypress framing material, along with the patina of layers of old paint are what really enhance the furniture and bring a unique look to the piece.

name: Quartz Porcelain Vase
description:
24 Carat Gold Rim (Gold Lustre) quartz porcelain vase. 

Iggy and Lou Lou was established in 2003 by Melbourne artist and designer Irene Grishin Selzer and her partner Peter Selzer. Together they built a label credited as a pioneer in the revival of porcelain jewelry and skulls.  They like getting their hands dirty, making everything in their studio.  With a Masters of Ceramics behind them, there is a strong emphasis on mixing the latest in ceramic technology with traditional making methods.  Drawing on the history and enduring romance of porcelain they place a great emphasis on craftsmanship – each piece is made by hand, meticulously finished and kiln fired up to 4 times.

Dimensions:

6" H x 2.36" Widest Diameter

name: Glass Curio
description:
A salvaged vintage window casement from an historic New Orleans home fronts a reclaimed lathe wood cabinet. The exterior features restored white siding, baseboard, and crown.

Matthew  Holdren designs and builds all of his furniture in his backyard workshop in New Orleans. All of his pieces are made from reclaimed material personally salvaged from 100+ year old new orleans homes left to rot or be torn down.  The old heart pine or cypress framing material, along with the patina of layers of old paint are what really enhance the furniture and bring a unique look to the piece. 

Dimensions:

92" H x 21" W x 20" D

name: Geo Wall Vase 7
description:
Stoneware ceramic wall hanging planters.
Individually sculpted and glazed, each of these sculptures are one of a kind and make a great vessel for an air plant or tiny succulent.

ZOLA is a handcrafted line of sculptural jewelry and objects designed and created in Philadelphia, PA by Gabrielle Miles Silverlight. Employing methods such as the lost wax process for bronze casting and hand-formed ceramics, ZOLA uses these materials to combine traditional technique with modern design. The collection of work is informed by the exploration of a material's multiplicities, often letting the process itself guide the finished result by embracing a spirit of chance and spontaneity.

Drawing inspiration from coastal landscapes, ZOLA embraces an aesthetic of 'organic geometry' that reflects both the rough edges and sweeping curves, the interplay of positive and negative space and the fluidity inherent in those landscapes. 
ZOLA aims to create tactile and elegant art pieces that are unexpected yet can fuse seamlessly into one's everyday wear or decor. 

Dimensions:

7.5" L x 5.5" W x 1.75" H

name: Leaf Spoon
description:
Black Walnut  10.5" long  smooth, shiny finish and sealed with blended wax.

Hand carved + Shaped by Board & Bread

Perfect for mixing, serving, and sauteing

name: Black Stoneware Cellar
description:
Each one handmade from beautiful black stoneware, interior is glazed for safe daily use, exterior is unglazed showcasing 
the gorgeous clay body. Customize a set for various dry good or that special found treasure. 

Nelle Design, a small pottery in upstate NY.  Each piece is designed, handmade & intended for daily use in your life and home.  

Approx size: 3.5"H X 2.5" W

name: Charcuterie Board
description:
Charcuterie Board crafted out of quarter sawn Tennessee white oak. Each board is hand selected for it's grain and features a hole for ease of transport and storage. Coated with food safe oil and beeswax finish.

HollerDesign creates and constructs furniture inspired by the traditions of the American South, but informed by modern sleekness and simplicity. And uniquely, each piece is sourced, designed and crafted from and on the Lascassas, Tenn., dairy farm that’s housed HollerD owner Matt Alexander’s family for more than a century. It’s a sustainable, resourceful and roots-rooted process that echoes the soul of the South.

name: Mink Grading Boards
description: Set of three antique mink grading boards.

name: Courtney Dress
description:
Midweight cotton stripe with woven dobby pattern. Fitted top with short-sleeves, full skirt with side pockets and contrast fabric belt. Invisible zipper at center back.

100% Cotton 

Using thoughtful modern design paired with traditional fabrics, Fisher is a collection of Mens and Womens casual clothing designed to layer into and complement the wearer’s existing wardrobe. Each piece is designed and manufactured in the USA using high quality materials from all over the world.

Fischer was founded in 2010 by Kristina Angelozzi and is based in Greenpoint, Brooklyn.

name: The Everyday
description:
Two piece vintage inspired ladies uniform. Short sleeve cropped blouse coupled with an A-line skirt in matching fabric. Each piece is custom made by hand to your specifications.  Enjoy the everyday.

Sharime Kayla Jobe is a New Orleans based stylist, photographer, and seamstress who believes firmly in the idea that all things can be made simply and beautifully. A one woman operation, all of Sharime's wares are created with love in her uptown home studio.  

*During checkout please provide your measurements for your chest, shoulders, and waist in the Note to Seller section, found under your address in Paypal.

name: Alice Top
description:
Lightweight cotton windowpane plaid woven tee. Loose fit all-over with bateau neck and mini pocket at left chest.

100% Cotton 

Using thoughtful modern design paired with traditional fabrics, Fisher is a collection of Mens and Womens casual clothing designed to layer into and complement the wearer’s existing wardrobe. Each piece is designed and manufactured in the USA using high quality materials from all over the world.

Fischer was founded in 2010 by Kristina Angelozzi and is based in Greenpoint, Brooklyn.

name: WWII Olive Overcoat
description:
Long olive overcoat from World War II with corded waist. Unlined cotton fabric make this jacket ideal for everyday. 

This coat is a size 54 but can easily adjust down to a size 42.

name: Waxed Canvas Croaker Sack
description:
Limited edition waxed canvas sack with depression era indigo feed sack lining the interior pockets. 

Peg and Awl was created by Philadephia couple, Margaux and Walter Kent. Their work is made from olde things, treasures found and recovered from misfortune and neglect, relics of the unusual, the confused and the macabre, cut and pulled and built into wearable curiosities, inscribable keepsakes and useable, longlasting treasures. They used to make them for themselves and now they make them for everyone.

name: Field Notes
description:
A gentleman should always be ready to jot down notes, or illustrate ideas, and inspiration. This rugged cover allows you to have your Field Notes memo book, Moleskin or even your passport with you at all times. Also, tuck away scrap notes or references in the inside pockets.

Stock & Barrel Co. produces timeless leather pieces using techniques that resemble old time American craftsmanship. They strive to keep their dollars on home soil by using American tanned leather and other materials sourced domestically. They create products of heirloom quality that will last for years, Handcrafted with an eye towards durability and style.

name: Small Leather Pouch
description:
Found tan leather pouch. 

To be carried or fixed upon your belt.

name: WWII Ash Wool Jacket
description: Wool and Silk-lined, this timeless Swedish coat hails from the World War II era. 100% wool with a heavy cotton lining, button closure, 4 outer pockets, and inside pocket.

name: Leather Apron
description:
One size fits all and no adjustment at the neck. This one is for the doers. The builders. The makers.

 Made with 3 oz top grain leather with waxy finish to add protection agains soil and stain.  Criss-cross, adjustable, easy fit, single leather tie at waist and natural edge leather pocket.

Stash Co is co-owned and operated by Cheryl Schulke and Paul Forde.  Their production studio is based in a century-old mattress factory.  Committed to utilizing vintage hand-tools, boot-making equipment, and good old-fashioned American ingenuity to craft each of their products.

name: Adam Henley
description:
This mens patchwork shirt is made of 4 different shades of lightweight 6oz fabric, blocked together. Classic casual fit, with single left chest pocket, curved hem, button down placket and 2 hole corozo fisheye buttons.

100% Cotton

Using thoughtful modern design paired with traditional fabrics, Fisher is a collection of Mens and Womens casual clothing designed to layer into and complement the wearer’s existing wardrobe. Each piece is designed and manufactured in the USA using high quality materials from all over the world.

Fischer was founded in 2010 by Kristina Angelozzi and is based in Greenpoint, Brooklyn.

name: Journal: Outpost No.8
description:
Hand-bound journal covered in abandoned materials.  Contents: Strathmore drawing paper, linen tape + thread, neutral PH adhesive & vintage headband.  Leather from late 1800's cowboy chaps, mid-century found in an abandoned house.   

Peg and Awl was created by Philadephia couple, Margaux and Walter Kent. Their work is made from olde things, treasures found and recovered from misfortune and neglect, relics of the unusual, the confused and the macabre, cut and pulled and built into wearable curiosities, inscribable keepsakes and useable, longlasting treasures. They used to make them for themselves and now they make them for everyone.

name: WWII Field Jacket
description: Wool World War II military coat. 100% wool with a heavy cotton lining, button closure with "3 crowns of Sweden" buttons, military insignia on the collar, 6 outer pockets (4 front, 2 back), and inside pocket. The lining is stamped with the 3 crowns of Sweden.

name: MADE IN USA STAMP TEE *Presale*
description:
All of the graphics on this tee were designed and will be individually block printed by hand by designer Ricky Ray Lester Jr. The graphics include the “Made in USA” stamp on the front, Ricky Ray Lester Jr.’s logo on the left sleeve, and a custom Ricky Ray Lester Jr. and Makers Workshop collaboration inside size label all designed in a vintage stoneware print aesthetic. Because these tees will be block printed by hand the print results will vary with each garment giving each stamped print it’s own unique characteristics. The fabric color will be a dark navy blue and have grey stamped graphics very similar to the images seen here.

Currently, this is a presale item. The shirts will be in the printing process and ready to ship out very soon. If you would like to purchase this item in advance they will be shipped to you as soon as they are finished, in order of date of purchase.

name: WWII Henley
description: Small World War II olive waffle knit henley.

name: The Hudson Pack (Orange)
description:
Sometimes you need something uncomplicated but strong. Your phone, laptop and even your Starbucks have sleeves. Its time you had something to help you carry them all on your daily adventures... except maybe the Starbucks.  

START YOUR ADVENTURE TODAY.

Materials:
Waxed 10.10 oz Canvas = Water repellant and easily cleaned all while environmentally friendly. 

Double Stitched w/ heavy duty thread

Padded Straps w/ Nylon

American made YKK zipper

Hand-made zipper pulls

Approx. Dimensions: H 16" X W 10" X D 5"

Simple Supply Goods

name: Yuba River Backpacker Cologne
description:
Juniper Ridge fragrance distilled from real plants, bark, moss, mushrooms, and other things found hiking in the back-country.

Scent notes: Northern Sierra lake shimmering with fall sunlight, Cedar, a cozy cabin and the smell of winter right around the corner.

1 oz- ORGANIC SUGAR CANE ALCOHOL; 100% NATURAL FRAGRANCE: TREE PITCH, PLANT SAP/JUICE, STEAM-DISTILLED ESSENTIAL OILS. 

Juniper Ridge was founded by Hall Newbegin in 1998. They are the world’s only wild fragrance company. They are hikers and backpackers, not fashion or luxury-industry types. They distill colognes and perfumes from real plants, bark, moss, mushrooms, and tree trimmings found hiking the backcountry.
A hundred years ago, all perfumes were made this way. Today they are the only ones who handle every step of the process ourselves, from beginning to end. That process can look pretty ridiculous at times. "We go camping. We crawl around in mountain meadows. We smell the wet earth beneath fir trees, and spend whiskey-fueled hours geeking out over the scent of wind off a glacier. We make our fragrances throughout the West Coast—on dirt roads and trails, around campfires, and in our Oakland, California workshop. All to capture the quiet beauty of the Mojave Desert at sunrise, or a late-season Sierra trailhead with winter right around the corner."

name: Sweetgrass Campfire Incense
description:
Made only with wildcrafted plants, tree sap, wood, and bark found hiking the back-country. No hidden ingredients. No charcoal or perfume. Incense for people who enjoy sitting around the campfire.

Scent notes: vanilla, fresh cut grass, cinnamon bread baking in the oven. 

WILDCRAFTED PLANTS, TREE SAP, WOOD, AND BAMBOO STICK. 20 STICKS 

Juniper Ridge was founded by Hall Newbegin in 1998. They are the world’s only wild fragrance company. They are hikers and backpackers, not fashion or luxury-industry types. They distill colognes and perfumes from real plants, bark, moss, mushrooms, and tree trimmings found hiking the backcountry.

description:
Pacific Northwest coastal forests in a bottle. Juniper Ridge fragrance distilled from plants, conifers, bark, moss, mushrooms, and other things found hiking in the Oregon back-country. An aromatic snapshot of life on the trail.

Scent notes: Mountains and rivers without end, conifer country and spicy Cedar, sparkly clear summer swimming holes with massive boulders down deep in the water.

1 oz.- ORGANIC SUGAR CANE ALCOHOL; 100% NATURAL FRAGRANCE: TREE PITCH, PLANT SAP/JUICE, STEAM-DISTILLED ESSENTIAL OILS.

name: The Great Outdoors Soap Set
description:
A fresh and natural collection of soap that will transport you to the wilderness.

This set consists of 4 handmade, cold-process bars of soap (Minimum of 4 oz per bar)

 *Pine Shampoo*- A quiet walk through the evergreen forest. This bar of soap is meant for your hair. Simply rub into your scalp while standing under the faucet. The scent is fresh and invigorating; it will leave your hair happier and healthier. A great bar for travel and camping.

*Cedar Soap*- Wonderfully gentle for everyday use. Cedar has a warm and woody scent. It will keep you clean from head to toe. 

*Campfire Soap*- The ultimate bar for anyone who is passionate about the smokey aroma of an evening fire. This soap has a soft, fluffy lather leaving your skin feeling smooth and majestic. 

*Charcoal Soap*- An exfoliating soap made with organic, sustainable coffee grounds as well as activated charcoal, which detoxifies the skin. Perfect for scrubbing away the residue of adventure. 

All of dark wood’s soaps are handmade in small batches, using only the best plant oils, herbs and essential oils. 

*No animal testing *No artificial fragrances *No lauryl sulfates 
EVER

name: Handmade Soap Dish
description:
Creamy white glaze covers this lovely handmade soap dish. ‘lather, rinse, repeat’ written on inside rim along with a 
hydrangea in center bottom. 

Nelle Design is a small pottery in upstate NY.  Each piece is designed, handmade & intended for daily use in your life and home.  

 Diameter:

4"

name: Cape Heartache
description:
Josh Meyer makes a perfume inspired by the rugged country in the Pacific Northwest. Then he invents a back-story around it, imagining that he has created a perfume based on a book by a famous author—when, in reality, Meyer himself is the creator of the whole thing. And now you understand the concept behind Portland-based Imaginary Authors, a deliciously inventive house that is a creative mashup of olfactory, literary, and graphical arts. Cape Heartache, the anticipated new release from Imaginary Authors, covers new territory for the line in the form of a deep, woodsy Pacific Northwest scent that captures the melancholy of lost love. A surprising interlude of strawberry hides among the cedar trees like memories that become sweeter only when you know they are lost forever. "If you are looking for the pieces of a broken heart," our imaginary author Philip Sava says, "you might try rifling through the twigs and needles on the forest floor."

NOTES: Douglas fir, pine resin, western hemlock, vanilla leaf, strawberry, old growth, and mountain fog.


60mL Eau de Parfume

Imaginary Authors

name: Memoirs of a Trespasser
description:
The early exploration writing of Philip Sava bent the limits of post-modern fiction, revealing fantastical worlds that fooled many into believing they were, in fact, real. Sava’s kaleidoscopic collections, of which Memoirs of a Trespasser is the undeniable centerpiece, drew upon true experiences from his exotic travels but were infused with a hallucinatory inventiveness that set his work apart from others in the genre.

Though Sava had associates all over the world, he spent most of his time living in solitude on a ranch in southern Madagascar. When interrogated by the press on his cloistered lifestyle he notoriously answered, “Who needs love when you have cognac?”

WHEN TO WEAR: A true adventure scent, wear Memoirs of a Trespasser when travelling, and again when you’re back home to conjure comforting memories.

NOTES: Madagascar Vanilla, Guaiacwood, Myrrh, Benzoin Resin, Ambrette Seeds & Oak Barrels

60mL Eau de Parfume

Imaginary Authors

description:
Porcelain container made from a mold of a birch log by Philadelphia ceramicists and designers, Heirloom Home and Studio 
Evergreen with a hint of sweet pine sap with pure White Pine essential oil 
Hand poured in small batches no greater than 35 candles

Made by Greenmarket Purveying Co., a group of people who love candles and natural bath products, organic soaps and extraordinary scents—scents that transport them to different times and places, scents that smell pure and fresh; like the plants and flowers that actually inspired them. People who were disappointed to find that such things were not as easy to find as they would like. People who love the idea of finding things in corner stores, farm markets and roadside stands, that are made and grown and created by hand in the United States. People who prefer things with a sense of time and place and history, who read books not devices, shop in stores not on sites, and who eat from a market basket not a tin can. 

All-natural fragrance

Proprietary soy wax blend

name: Geo Wall Vase 6
description:
Stoneware ceramic wall hanging planters.
Individually sculpted and glazed, each of these sculptures are one of a kind and make a great vessel for an air plant or tiny succulent.

ZOLA is a handcrafted line of sculptural jewelry and objects designed and created in Philadelphia, PA by Gabrielle Miles Silverlight. Employing methods such as the lost wax process for bronze casting and hand-formed ceramics, ZOLA uses these materials to combine traditional technique with modern design. The collection of work is informed by the exploration of a material's multiplicities, often letting the process itself guide the finished result by embracing a spirit of chance and spontaneity.

Drawing inspiration from coastal landscapes, ZOLA embraces an aesthetic of 'organic geometry' that reflects both the rough edges and sweeping curves, the interplay of positive and negative space and the fluidity inherent in those landscapes. 
ZOLA aims to create tactile and elegant art pieces that are unexpected yet can fuse seamlessly into one's everyday wear or decor.

Dimensions:

6" L x 6" W x 1.75" H

name: Large Spirit House Tapestry
description:
The "Spirit House" tapestries are woven from hand-dyed yarns, mounted on a natural indigo dyed canvas and frame.

The "Spirit House" tapestries are a new series made exclusively for Maker's Workshop by Squidwhale Designs."They explore a long-held memory of mine from a visit my family took to the Eklutna Cemetery about a half hour away from our former home in Anchorage, Alaska. I was a very small child at the time and have identified my visit there as my first true memory, from my own child-like perspective, rather than a "memory" cultivated from hearing a story about myself over the years.
The Eklutna Cemetery has a very old and fascinating history, the synthesis of native Dena'ina traditions and Russian imperialist influences. The result is a completely unique new tradition for the people there; the construction of funerary Spirit Houses, a tradition practiced today still."

Dimensions:

22" W x 20" H

name: Small Green Spirit House
description:
The "Spirit House" tapestries are woven from hand-dyed yarns, mounted on a natural indigo dyed canvas and frame.

I was a very small child at the time and have identified my visit there as my first true memory, from my own child-like perspective, rather than a "memory" cultivated from hearing a story about myself over the years.
The Eklutna Cemetery has a very old and fascinating history, the synthesis of native Dena'ina traditions and Russian imperialist influences. The result is a completely unique new tradition for the people there; the construction of funerary Spirit Houses, a tradition practiced today still."

Dimensions:

name: Star Cross Pendant Lariat
description:
Handmade Star cross pendant Lariat necklace. Made using old and modern wax techniques. Made with love in Brooklyn.  

Oxidized white brass.

 Rebel & Quill is a New York-based jewelry brand that channels the duality of a rebellious spirit coupled with the delicate beauty of a feather. Inspired by archaeological relics, artifacts and raw primitive naturalism, and made using wax techniques and hand fabrication.

Founded by Caroline Kim in 2013, each artifact of Rebel & Quill jewelry is passionately hand crafted in her Williamsburg, Brooklyn studio. She instantly fell in love with the art of creating, driven by her desire to transform any raw material into something beautiful and unique. While she prides herself on her meticulous detail oriented design her enigmatic rough-soft combination has become signature to the collection.

name: Charcuterie Board
description:
Charcuterie Board crafted out of quarter sawn Tennessee white oak. Each board is hand selected for it's grain and features a hole for ease of transport and storage. Coated with food safe oil and beeswax finish.

HollerDesign creates and constructs furniture inspired by the traditions of the American South, but informed by modern sleekness and simplicity. And uniquely, each piece is sourced, designed and crafted from and on the Lascassas, Tenn., dairy farm that’s housed HollerD owner Matt Alexander’s family for more than a century. It’s a sustainable, resourceful and roots-rooted process that echoes the soul of the South.
